title: Convert an Image into a Line Drawing: Easy Photoshop Tutorial

steps.title: Open an image in Adobe Photoshop.
steps.content: Open an image in Adobe Photoshop. With the program open, click File in the top menu, then Open… . You'll be able to locate and select your image. [1] X Research source If you haven't already, you'll need to download Photoshop. This method works best for simple images with high contrasts. If you need to convert a detailed image into lines, this method will not work. You can also choose to trace the image using the Pen Tool.

steps.title: Click Image in the top menu, then Grayscale.
steps.content: Click Image in the top menu, then Grayscale . A new window will open and ask you to flatten your image before changing modes. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Flatten.
steps.content: Click Flatten . A new window will open to confirm the discarding of color information. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Discard.
steps.content: Click Discard . Your image will now be in grayscale. [4] X Research source 4

steps.title: Click Layer in the top menu, then Duplicate Layer….
steps.content: Click Layer in the top menu, then Duplicate Layer… . This will make a copy of your image. [5] X Research source Alternatively, you can right-click the layer in your Layers panel and click Duplicate Layer .

steps.title: In the Layers panel, click Normal.
steps.content: In the Layers panel, click Normal . This will open the drop-down menu with different layer modes. Make sure your duplicated layer is selected.

steps.title: Click Color Dodge.
steps.content: Click Color Dodge . This will input the Color Dodge effect, which lightens the colors of the base layers to reduce the contrast. [6] X Research source Your image should resemble a line drawing. You may have some dark spots in areas if the color was particularly dark.

steps.title: Select the Magic Wand Tool.
steps.content: Select the Magic Wand Tool. You may have to expand the Quick Selection Tool to find the Magic Wand Tool.

steps.title: Click the dark area.
steps.content: Click the dark area. The Magic Wand will automatically select the dark area within the thicker lines.

steps.title: On your keyboard, press Del.
steps.content: On your keyboard, press Del . This will delete the dark area. Alternatively, you can click Edit in the top menu, then Cut . Repeat this step until all dark areas are gone and you're left with crisp lines.

steps.title: Save your line drawing.
steps.content: Save your line drawing. In the top menu, click File , then Save As… . Name your file and click Save . If you want to work on this project again later, you can make a PSD file .
